definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: ) regard, recognize (NH Hiph. know, be acquainted with; Targum Aph. id.; Syr. Aph. 0akar id.; cf. also Ar. nakira in sense be shrewd, cunning;—

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 mpl. [[לאׁ]] [[נִכְּרוּ]] La 4:8 they are not recognized.

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Pf. [[לאׁ נִכַּר שׁוֹעַ לִפְנֵי־דָָל]] Job 34:19 he regardeth not the opulent above the poor (‖[[לאׁ־נׇשָׂא פְּנֵי שָׂרִים]]); Impf. [[לאׁ תְנַכֵָּרוּ]] Job 21:29 do ye not recognize their tokens.

regard, observe, esp. with a view to recognition, c. obj. cl., Ge 31:32, Ge 37:32, Ge 38:25; pay attention to, c. acc. pers. Ru 2:10, Ru 2:19; acc. rei (of God) Job 34:25; acc. rei om. 2Sa 3:36; ´[[י]] subj. [[לְטוֹבָה]] …[[כֵּן אַכִּיר ]] Je 24:5 so will I regard the exiles ... for good; Antiochus subj. Da 11:39; [[הִכִּיר פָּנִים]] pay regard to (shew partiality, = ´[[נׇשָׂא פְּנֵי פ]]) De 1:17, De 16:19 (‖[[הִטָּה מִשְׁפָּט]]), Pr 24:23, Pr 28:21.

Recognize (as formerly known) c. acc. pers. vel rei, Ge 27:23, Ge 37:33, Ge 38:26 (all J), Ge 42:7, Ge 42:8, Ge 42:8 (E), 1Ki 18:7, 1Ki 20:41, Job 2:12; proverb. [[בְּטֶרֶם יַכִּיר אִישׁ]] [[אֶת־רֵעֵהוּ]] Ru 3:14 before a man could recognize his fellow (i.e. before dawn); recognize voice ([[קוֹל]]), Ju Jdg 18:3, 1Sa 26:17; = perceive the true situation, [[וׇאַכִּירָה וְהִנֵּה]] Ne 6:12 and I perceived, and lo! God had not sent him.
Be willing to recognize, acknowledge De 21:17, De 33:9, Is 63:16 (‖[[יָדַע]]), Ps 142:5; acknowledge with honour Is 61:9.
Be acquainted with, [[לאׁ יַכִּירֶנּוּ עוֹד מְקוֹמוֹ]] Job 7:10 his place shall be acquainted with him no more (he shall be gone and forgotten), cf. Ps 103:16; c. acc. rei Job 24:17.

Distinguish, understand, [[לְקוֹל]] …[[הִכִּיר קוֹל ]] Ezr 3:13 could not distinguish, etc.; cf. Job 4:16 could not distinguish its appearance; [[הִכִּיר לְדַבֵּר]] Ne 13:24 understand how to speak, etc.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Impf. [[יִתְנַכֶּר־נׇ֑עַר]] Pr 20:11 by his deeds a youth maketh himself known, whether his doing be pure, etc.
